intro: Lepeocercis digitata, commonly known as the digitate lepeocercis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, digitate (finger-like) leaves that are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Lepeocercis digitata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
